mng: to cheat, to swindle, to pretend, to feign, to draw sb out, to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

exm.mng: to rip off, to extort (money), extortion, blackmail
to defraud, to swindle, to blackmail
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception, each tries to outwit the other, dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to extort under false pretenses, to blackmail, to bluff, to defraud
